title: Merge Strings Alternately
description:
Merge Strings Alternately

You are given two strings, word1 and word2. Construct a new string by merging them in alternating order, starting with word1 â€” take one character from word1, then one from word2, and repeat this process.

If one string is longer than the other, append the remaining characters from the longer string to the end of the merged result.

Return the final merged string.

Examples:

  • Input: word1 = "abc", word2 = "xyz"
    Output: "axbycz"
  • Input: word1 = "ab", word2 = "abbxxc"
    Output: "aabbbxxc"

Constraints:

  • 1 <= word1.length, word2.length <= 100
  • word1 and word2 consist of lowercase English letters.
solution_text:
Merge Strings Alternately

Algorithm:

  1. Use two pointers to track position in each string
  2. Alternate taking characters from word1 and word2
  3. When one string is exhausted, append remaining characters from the other

Time Complexity: O(m + n) where m and n are lengths of the strings

Space Complexity: O(m + n) for the result string

Key Insights:

  • Two pointers technique handles different length strings
  • Simple alternating pattern with edge case handling
  • Can be solved with iteration or by building result character by character
verify:
def verify(actual_output, expected_output):
    """Verify the merged string result"""
    passed = actual_output == expected_output
    output_str = str(actual_output) if actual_output is not None else 'None'
    
    return [passed, output_str]
